page.title: 20NEWCOMER'S VIEW OF CLAYPOLE
page.content: My family and I moved into Tinsley Close, Claypole in June 1976. Why you may ask, ten years later, am I writing as a newcomer to the village? Many of the families in the village have lived here for generations: great grandparents, grandparents, parents and children all still live in the area. A local farmer showed me a tree which he had just planted and said "This will be no use in my time but my grandchildren will enjoy sitting under it." What is ten years in this time scale? The building of Tinsley Close, a small cul de sac, was quite a cultural shock to this close knit community and the village became divided into two camps, them' and 'us', old and new. Slowly however both compromised; we merged and the line became indistinct and now we are part of the community.
